1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Our premiere episode. We have Catherine Curtin, AKA Wanda Bell from Orange Is The New Black and Dustin's mom from Stranger Things calling in to talk about her experiences on set, how to grow and succeed in a changing industry.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: We chat with Derek Wayne Johnson about his celebrity studded documentary on the director of Rocky and Karate Kid: John Avildsen: King of the Underdogs, plus his upcoming documentary on Grammy nominated artist Frank Stallone.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: We chat with Debra Markowitz, VP of the Long Island International Film Expo about film festivals, the industry and what it's like working with SAG Award winners.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: We chat with Vincent Veloso, director, filmmaker, actor, musician (he plays 17 instruments!), dancer and martial artist about his project Changelings on Amazon, weird experiences on set, Urban Action Showcase and other things.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: In a Q&A session from the fans, JT and Scott discuss their worst experiences on a film set. Also, a old-school Nintendo trivia contest with uncomfortable consequences.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Trivia time again. Can Scott avenge his humiliating loss from last week and finally win a contest against JT?

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: We chat with James Rolfe about life as The Angry Video Game Nerd, plus Monster Madness, his plans for the future and a ton more.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: We chat with director Christoper Downie on his Kevin Smith biopic Shooting Clerks. Scott also ranks Terminator films and we discuss if The Fugitive can be considered a St. Patrick's Day film the same way Die Hard is a Christmas movie.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Scott and JT discuss whether the Room is truly the worst movie ever made. Also a comic trivia contest alongside Ming Chen and whether Thor Ragnarok was TOO comedic.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Scott and JT chat with respected NYC casting director Donna McKenna about what works and what doesn't when auditioning. Plus Scott gives his thoughts on the Roseanne reboot series.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Scott and JT chat with Jennifer Marie who recently won Audience Choice at the recent Lovesick Film Festival (and casting show producer Robin!). Also Scott reads an article written about him questioning his sexuality.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: JT is out sick so Scott and Robin run the show. Scott rants about the antiquated and extremely frustrating system most actors have to deal with to get paid on a job.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Our interview with Lloyd Kaufman. We talk Troma, his feelings on the industry (and the Sundance Film Festival in particular!) and what's on the horizon. Also Scott talks about how he became an ordained reverend.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: JT and Scott talk about Kanye West's recent "odd" tweets, Infinity Wars and the stunt Scott did that almost broke his jaw. Oops.

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: With Tyrell Jason in studio, we discuss his film The Bullet (which Scott was part of) plus the technical back end of film making. Also JT and Scott discuss the recent release of Cobra Kai on YouTube Red (no spoilers).

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: We chat with award winning filmmaker Kylie Garcelon about her films Moral Compass and The Dog Walker, plus her inspiration into making a film about Alzheimers.

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: Scott and JT discuss their experience from a technical perspective on online piracy. Also Scott talks about being a geek back in the old days, before comics and sci-fi were really socially acceptable.

18.title: Happy Birthday JT
18.plot: As JT turns a full third of a century, we discuss the recent cancellation of Roseanne, the box office failure of Solo and the future of both series.

19.title: London Calling, We Answered
19.plot: As Robin and Scott are currently in London, they discuss the advance screening of Jurrasic Park: Fallen Kingdom and their thoughts of the film. No spoilers.

20.title: Oh Hai Robyn Paris!
20.plot: Ahh The Room...Scott's favorite movie ever. Of all time. We chat with Robyn Paris, AKA Michelle from The Room about her experiences working with Tommy, how she got the role and her new project: The Room Actors...Where Are They Now?

21.title: 21 And Not Done
21.plot: We talk about the recent release of Jurassic World, the perils of Pee Wee Herman years ago and how he's recovered. Plus Robin tells a story of watching several unexpected (VERY explicit) sex scenes alongside her parents at a film festival.

22.title: 22 and Not Through
22.plot: With Ryan "Big O" O'Regan in studio we discuss his thoughts on Ant-Man and the Wasp. Also Scott talks about as the chubby bullied kid he was growing up why the new Ninja Sex Party video Danny Don't You Know meant so much to him.

23.title: Back with Deb Markowitz (23 to LIIFE)
23.plot: Back with Deb Markowitz again. With the Long Island International Film Expo back in town we talk the festival, her upcoming projects and her recent article in Newsweek.

24.title: Putting Background to the Forefront
24.plot: Independent film actor Richard Hass joins us in the studio to talk about weird experiences he's had on set (including a TV show once losing his car entirely), the museum fire scene in The Greatest Showman and several other stories.

25.title: TheaterYAP with A.J. Ciccotelli
25.plot: We chat with Mr. AJ Ciccotelli, Artistic Director of the La Strada Ensemble Theater about his experiences both on the stage and off it, including performing at London's Globe Theatre and casting projects in NY and NJ.

26.title: Tribute to the Odd
26.plot: In an episode dedicated to the odd, the group discusses ESPN's recent foray into odd spots for "Ocho Day" (8/8), including Chess Boxing, Sumo wrestling and competitive eating. Also they discuss JT and Scott's new film up on Amazon prime.

27.title: AnimationYAP
27.plot: Animation-Nation. We give our thoughts on Attack on Titan and Ducktales (neither JT hasn't seen) and Disenchantment and Dancing in the Franxx (neither Scott hasn't seen).

29.title: MomoSapiens
29.plot: Scott talks about people playing the "Momo Challenge" and how it was the scariest thing he's seen on YouTube. Also he and JT discuss SAG projects vs. non-SAG projects and whether SAG is truly the right way to go for a film.

30.title: Westfield International Film Festival
30.plot: We're live at the Westfield International Film Festival. (JT is the sound engineer) We chat with Angelo Reyes about his film Groomed and receiving the Rising Star Award at the festival and get an unexpected visit from Hang Onto Your Shorts founder CJ Cullen.

31.title: Doctor Who's On First?
31.plot: A new doctor is here. Scott, Robin and special guest Ryan "Big O" O'Regan discuss the new season and whether new writer Chris Chibnall's plans for the series will help or hurt the beloved franchise going forward (Scott is skeptical). Also Ryan gives his review of the new Venom movie.

32.title: Joker's Wild
32.plot: Challenges on the new Joker film. We talk about the recent articles in TMZ and Variety about leaving extras in train cars for hours without a break to use the bathroom. We also talk about Dr. Who and give our thoughts on the new season.

34.title: Once More Mi Amore
34.plot: With Robin out sick, Ming Chen handles the boards. We talk Castlevania season 2, the future of Apu from the Simpsons and if the writing on Dr. Who has gotten any better.

35.title: 35 and Still Alive
35.plot: Scott discusses his love of a Tommy Wiseau movie possibly worse than The Room. Also, Stan Vs. Evil plus if people in the Harry Potter universe ever need to call a plumber.

imdb.title: FilmYAP
plot: Produced by Ming Chen of AMC's Comic Book Men, _FilmYAP_ (qv) is an entertainment podcast with celebrity guests and commentary about film, TV, games and all things pop culture.::Scott Churchson
